Title: Collection of Poems (Divan)
Dimensions: Folio H: 5 5/16 x W: 3 1/8 in. (13.5 x 8 cm)
Medium: ink and pigments on laid paper covered with lacquer with gold
Description: Walters manuscript W.637 is an illustrated and illuminated copy of the collection of poems (divan) by Shams al-Din Muhammad Hafiz al-Shirazi (active 8th century AH/AD 14th), produced in India, possibly Kashmir, in the 13th century AH/AD 19th. It opens with an illuminated headpiece with the doxological formula (basmalah) (fol. 1b); there are 20 illustrations. The lacquer binding with central floral design is contemporary with the manuscript.
Keywords: Fatimid; Islamic; Persian; Book; Codex; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Original Binding; India; Sufism; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Hafiz (Persian, flourished 8th century AH/AD 14th century)
